thread.title: The Spy Who Beat the CIA Torture Regime
thread.title_full: The Spy Who Beat the CIA Torture Regime

author: Mikael Thalen
title: The Spy Who Beat the CIA Torture Regime
text:
The Spy Who Beat the CIA Torture Regime How a CIA agent went from decorated al-Qaeda hunter to persecuted prisoner David Knight | Infowars.com   
Decorated CIA veteran John Kiriakou led the team that caught the first al-Qaeda leader ever captured. He became the whistleblower who warned the nation about the CIAâ€™s illegal torture practices. His experiences as a spy give us a glimpse into the culture of the CIA. He explains in detail the practice of waterboarding and its ethical, practical and legal consequences. 
Kiriakou embodies the persevering struggle for liberty against political persecution. The torturers, the lawyers and the officials in the program never went to jail, but he did.
